Description: Painted limestone shabti of Samut with a blue lappet-wig with incised striations, a carved face with the eyes traced with black, a red and blue low relief collar and a low relief pectoral decorated with a depiction of a winged scarab, crossed hands in low relief, the front and back of the legs are inscribed with central columns of incised black Hieroglyphs within black borderlines, the back has a red seed-basket.
